text: Thanks for the info. Is there any planned date for release or is it just a case of when its ready?
You can also use the resize_image_url() function in HubL to force certain sizes in modules (e.g. hero and gallery) where editors might be less toughtfull of the images that they upload and use.
I believe this one is a "when it's ready/if it's popular" release.

I set up a new domain and have been building a separate website. When I search for a term that I know is in my blog articles, it's not returning anything. Is there a way I can specify what blog it should be searching and what pages/domain? I have been looking at the developer docs and I see this thing about a search API but I have no clue how to implement that in my templates. Do I add something to the search results template? Or where my search input field is? Or somewhere else entirely? And I'm not sure how to add it. I see some code I haven't used before, it's not hubl, I see json ... I am lost.
How is that not the same as the current implementation where the classes are actually in the template files and not something a marketer would be modifying?

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/features/content-search>

Where does this json go? the article doesn't seem to specify ??

I just realized I had no follow on all the pages and posts, and that could prevent indexing for the search. I took that off, but it's still not finding anything. Perhaps a cache issue? How long would it take for me to know if this was the issue and results would start to return or if there's still some other issue. The thing I'm not sure about is how does the search know what blog and website to search? based on the domain?

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!

Real crazy random thing — Does anyone else go to the HubSpot community site and it is in a different language? I beileve in the past year I’ve seen three different languages. The most dificult one for me was symbols, and I was on mobile.

Just curious if this has happened to anyone else

Our client wants their site analytics in HubSpot so they are able to report on what companies are visiting what pages on the site. They want to attribute visits to LinkedIn campaigns. Currently theyre looking at that data in Zoominfo but it’s very hard to get reports out of it.

Does the Wordpress plugin help with that? Or is there a secondary step to take?
Yes! I think I get English maybe 1/5 times I visit, I've seen a ton of different languages. Makes the problem solving more fun lol.
Unfortunately not, it's essentially a bug at this point :smile:
Yes, it always wants to show me the article in French.

All the Wordpress plugin does is automatically install the HubSpot tracking script on their website. Once the script is installed, type website visits into the search bar, and they'll be able to see a list of companies visiting the website, # of page views, and # of visitors. I've found that HubSpot struggles to remove the internet service providers and the information we see in HS vs. ZoomInfo's Websights is almost always different. You can also setup a reoccurring email report of web traffic from HubSpot.
Oh my. I’m not going crazy about this. I can’t even remember how long this has been going on but everyone it happens no one is around to say hey look!!!
Yes, Same here , I always landed with the French version of that.

Yes, in settings > pages > system pages based on selected domains, you have to set search results template. If you are using custom search results template then clone and edit the default search input and search results modules as per your need.
